title: Zone Settings
description: A Zone setting changes how the Zone works in relation to caching, security, or other features of Cloudflare

zone_settings_cfduid_deprecation.description:
The __cfduid cookie was set on Cloudflare HTTP responses and was used for providing critical performance and security services on behalf of our customers. Now, we are working to transition our security services to not depend on this cookie. You can read more about this change on our blog: https://blog.cloudflare.com/deprecating-cfduid-cookie/

On 8 April, we will temporarily remove the cfduid cookie for about 12 hours after 16:00 UTC.

Starting on 10 May 2021, we will permanently stop adding a “Set-Cookie” header on all HTTP responses. The last __cfduid cookies will expire 30 days after that.

links.title: Get all Zone settings
links.description: Available settings for your user in relation to a zone

links.title: Get Advanced DDOS setting
links.description: Advanced protection from Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks on your website. This is an uneditable value that is 'on' in the case of Business and Enterprise zones

links.title: Get Always Online setting
links.description: When enabled, Cloudflare serves limited copies of web pages available from the [Internet Archive's Wayback Machine](https://archive.org/web/) if your server is offline. Refer to [Always Online](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/about/always-online) for more information.

links.title: Get Always Use HTTPS setting
links.description: Reply to all requests for URLs that use "http" with a 301 redirect to the equivalent "https" URL. If you only want to redirect for a subset of requests, consider creating an "Always use HTTPS" page rule.

links.title: Get Opportunistic Onion setting
links.description: Add an Alt-Svc header to all legitimate requests from Tor, allowing the connection to use our onion services instead of exit nodes.

links.title: Get Orange to Orange (O2O)
links.description: Orange to Orange (O2O) allows zones on Cloudflare to CNAME to other zones also on Cloudflare.

links.title: Get Automatic HTTPS Rewrites setting
links.description: Enable the Automatic HTTPS Rewrites feature for this zone.

links.title: Get Browser Cache TTL setting
links.description: Browser Cache TTL (in seconds) specifies how long Cloudflare-cached resources will remain on your visitors' computers. Cloudflare will honor any larger times specified by your server. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168276)

links.title: Get Browser Check setting
links.description: Browser Integrity Check is similar to Bad Behavior and looks for common HTTP headers abused most commonly by spammers and denies access to your page.  It will also challenge visitors that do not have a user agent or a non standard user agent (also commonly used by abuse bots, crawlers or visitors). (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170086)

links.title: Get Cache Level setting
links.description: Cache Level functions based off the setting level. The basic setting will cache most static resources (i.e., css, images, and JavaScript). The simplified setting will ignore the query string when delivering a cached resource. The aggressive setting will cache all static resources, including ones with a query string. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168256)

links.title: Get Challenge TTL setting
links.description: Specify how long a visitor is allowed access to your site after successfully completing a challenge (such as a CAPTCHA). After the TTL has expired the visitor will have to complete a new challenge. We recommend a 15 - 45 minute setting and will attempt to honor any setting above 45 minutes. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170136)

links.title: Get Development Mode setting
links.description: Development Mode temporarily allows you to enter development mode for your websites if you need to make changes to your site. This will bypass Cloudflare's accelerated cache and slow down your site, but is useful if you are making changes to cacheable content (like images, css, or JavaScript) and would like to see those changes right away. Once entered, development mode will last for 3 hours and then automatically toggle off.

links.title: Get Early Hints setting
links.description: When enabled, Cloudflare will attempt to speed up overall page loads by serving `103` responses with `Link` headers from the final response. Refer to [Early Hints](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/about/early-hints) for more information.

links.title: Get Email Obfuscation setting
links.description: Encrypt email adresses on your web page from bots, while keeping them visible to humans. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170016)

links.title: Get Hotlink Protection setting
links.description: When enabled, the Hotlink Protection option ensures that other sites cannot suck up your bandwidth by building pages that use images hosted on your site. Anytime a request for an image on your site hits Cloudflare, we check to ensure that it's not another site requesting them. People will still be able to download and view images from your page, but other sites won't be able to steal them for use on their own pages. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170026)

links.title: Get IP Geolocation setting
links.description: Enable IP Geolocation to have Cloudflare geolocate visitors to your website and pass the country code to you. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168236)

links.title: Get IPv6 setting
links.description: Enable IPv6 on all subdomains that are Cloudflare enabled.  (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168586)

links.title: Get Minify setting
links.description: Automatically minify certain assets for your website. Refer to [Using Cloudflare Auto Minify](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168196) for more information.

links.title: Get Mobile Redirect setting
links.description: Automatically redirect visitors on mobile devices to a mobile-optimized subdomain. Refer to [Understanding Cloudflare Mobile Redirect](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200168336) for more information.

links.title: Get Mirage setting
links.description: Automatically optimize image loading for website visitors on mobile devices. Refer to [our blog post](http://blog.cloudflare.com/mirage2-solving-mobile-speed) for more information.

links.title: Get Enable Error Pages On setting
links.description: Cloudflare will proxy customer error pages on any 502,504 errors on origin server instead of showing a default Cloudflare error page. This does not apply to 522 errors and is limited to Enterprise Zones.

links.title: Get Opportunistic Encryption setting
links.description: Gets Opportunistic Encryption setting.

links.title: Get Polish setting
links.description: Removes metadata and compresses your images for faster page load times. Basic (Lossless): Reduce the size of PNG, JPEG, and GIF files - no impact on visual quality. Basic + JPEG (Lossy): Further reduce the size of JPEG files for faster image loading. Larger JPEGs are converted to progressive images, loading a lower-resolution image first and ending in a higher-resolution version. Not recommended for hi-res photography sites.

links.title: Get WebP setting
links.description: When the client requesting the image supports the WebP image codec, and WebP offers a performance advantage over the original image format, Cloudflare will serve a WebP version of the original image.

links.title: Get Brotli setting
links.description: When the client requesting an asset supports the brotli compression algorithm, Cloudflare will serve a brotli compressed version of the asset.

links.title: Get prefetch preload setting
links.description: Cloudflare will prefetch any URLs that are included in the response headers. This is limited to Enterprise Zones.

links.title: Get Privacy Pass setting
links.description: Privacy Pass is a browser extension developed by the Privacy Pass Team to improve the browsing experience for your visitors. Enabling Privacy Pass will reduce the number of CAPTCHAs shown to your visitors. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/115001992652-Privacy-Pass)

links.title: Get Response Buffering setting
links.description: Enables or disables buffering of responses from the proxied server. Cloudflare may buffer the whole payload to deliver it at once to the client versus allowing it to be delivered in chunks. By default, the proxied server streams directly and is not buffered by Cloudflare. This is limited to Enterprise Zones.

links.title: Get Rocket Loader setting
links.description: Rocket Loader is a general-purpose asynchronous JavaScript optimisation that prioritises rendering your content while loading your site's Javascript asynchronously. Turning on Rocket Loader will immediately improve a web page's rendering time sometimes measured as Time to First Paint (TTFP), and also the `window.onload` time (assuming there is JavaScript on the page). This can have a positive impact on your Google search ranking. When turned on, Rocket Loader will automatically defer the loading of all Javascript referenced in your HTML, with no configuration required. Refer to [Understanding Rocket Loader](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200168056) for more information.

links.title: Get Security Header (HSTS) setting
links.description: Cloudflare security header for a zone.

links.title: Get Security Level setting
links.description: Choose the appropriate security profile for your website, which will automatically adjust each of the security settings. If you choose to customize an individual security setting, the profile will become Custom. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170056)

links.title: Get Server Side Exclude setting
links.description: If there is sensitive content on your website that you want visible to real visitors, but that you want to hide from suspicious visitors, all you have to do is wrap the content with Cloudflare SSE tags. Wrap any content that you want to be excluded from suspicious visitors in the following SSE tags: <!--sse--><!--/sse-->. For example: <!--sse-->  Bad visitors won't see my phone number, 555-555-5555 <!--/sse-->. Note: SSE only will work with HTML. If you have HTML minification enabled, you won't see the SSE tags in your HTML source when it's served through Cloudflare. SSE will still function in this case, as Cloudflare's HTML minification and SSE functionality occur on-the-fly as the resource moves through our network to the visitor's computer. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170036)

links.title: Get Enable Query String Sort setting
links.description: Cloudflare will treat files with the same query strings as the same file in cache, regardless of the order of the query strings. This is limited to Enterprise Zones.

links.title: Get SSL setting
links.description: SSL encrypts your visitor's connection and safeguards credit card numbers and other personal data to and from your website. SSL can take up to 5 minutes to fully activate. Requires Cloudflare active on your root domain or www domain. Off: no SSL between the visitor and Cloudflare, and no SSL between Cloudflare and your web server  (all HTTP traffic). Flexible: SSL between the visitor and Cloudflare -- visitor sees HTTPS on your site, but no SSL between Cloudflare and your web server. You don't need to have an SSL cert on your web server, but your vistors will still see the site as being HTTPS enabled. Full:  SSL between the visitor and Cloudflare -- visitor sees HTTPS on your site, and SSL between Cloudflare and your web server. You'll need to have your own SSL cert or self-signed cert at the very least. Full (Strict): SSL between the visitor and Cloudflare -- visitor sees HTTPS on your site, and SSL between Cloudflare and your web server. You'll need to have a valid SSL certificate installed on your web server. This certificate must be signed by a certificate authority, have an expiration date in the future, and respond for the request domain name (hostname). (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170416)

links.title: Get SSL/TLS Recommender enrollment
links.description: Enrollment in the SSL/TLS Recommender service which tries to detect and recommend (by sending periodic emails) the most secure SSL/TLS setting your origin servers support.

links.title: Get Minimum TLS Version setting
links.description: Gets Minimum TLS Version setting.

links.title: Get ciphers setting
links.description: Gets ciphers setting.

links.title: Get TLS 1.3 setting enabled for a zone
links.description: Gets TLS 1.3 setting enabled for a zone.

links.title: Get TLS Client Auth setting
links.description: TLS Client Auth requires Cloudflare to connect to your origin server using a client certificate (Enterprise Only)

links.title: Get True Client IP setting
links.description: Allows customer to continue to use True Client IP (Akamai feature) in the headers we send to the origin. This is limited to Enterprise Zones.

links.title: Get Proxy Read Timeout setting
links.description: Maximum time between two read operations from origin

links.title: Get Web Application Firewall (WAF) setting
links.description: The WAF examines HTTP requests to your website.  It inspects both GET and POST requests and applies rules to help filter out illegitimate traffic from legitimate website visitors. The Cloudflare WAF inspects website addresses or URLs to detect anything out of the ordinary. If the Cloudflare WAF determines suspicious user behavior, then the WAF will 'challenge' the web visitor with a page that asks them to submit a CAPTCHA successfully  to continue their action. If the challenge is failed, the action will be stopped. What this means is that Cloudflare's WAF will block any traffic identified as illegitimate before it reaches your origin web server. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200172016)

links.title: Get HTTP2 setting
links.description: Value of the HTTP2 setting.

links.title: Get HTTP3 setting
links.description: Value of the HTTP3 setting.

links.title: Get Origin Max HTTP Version setting
links.description: Value of the Origin Max HTTP Version setting (Note: default for Enterprise only is "1")

links.title: Get 0-RTT session resumption setting
links.description: Gets 0-RTT session resumption setting.

links.title: Get Pseudo IPv4 setting
links.description: Value of the Pseudo IPv4 setting

links.title: Get WebSockets setting
links.description: Gets Websockets setting. For more information about Websockets, please refer to [Using Cloudflare with WebSockets](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200169466-Using-Cloudflare-with-WebSockets).

links.title: Get Image Resizing setting
links.description: Image Resizing provides on-demand resizing, conversion and optimisation for images served through Cloudflare's network. (https://developers.cloudflare.com/images/)

links.title: Get HTTP/2 Edge Prioritization setting
links.description: Gets HTTP/2 Edge Prioritization setting.

links.title: Get Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress settings
links.description: [Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress](https://developers.cloudflare.com/automatic-platform-optimization/) serves your WordPress site from Cloudflare's edge network and caches third-party fonts.

links.title: Edit zone settings info
links.description: Edit settings for a zone

items.description: One or more zone setting objects. Must contain an ID and a value.

links.title: Change Always Online setting
links.description: When enabled, Cloudflare serves limited copies of web pages available from the [Internet Archive's Wayback Machine](https://archive.org/web/) if your server is offline. Refer to [Always Online](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/about/always-online) for more information.

links.description: Reply to all requests for URLs that use "http" with a 301 redirect to the equivalent "https" URL. If you only want to redirect for a subset of requests, consider creating an "Always use HTTPS" page rule.

links.title: Change Opportunistic Onion setting
links.description: Add an Alt-Svc header to all legitimate requests from Tor, allowing the connection to use our onion services instead of exit nodes.

value.cfNotes: Default value depends on the zone's plan level.

links.title: Change Orange to Orange (O2O)
links.description: Orange to Orange (O2O) allows zones on Cloudflare to CNAME to other zones also on Cloudflare.

links.title: Change Automatic HTTPS Rewrites setting
links.description: Enable the Automatic HTTPS Rewrites feature for this zone.

value.cfNotes: Default value depends on the zone's plan level.

links.title: Change Browser Cache TTL setting
links.description: Browser Cache TTL (in seconds) specifies how long Cloudflare-cached resources will remain on your visitors' computers. Cloudflare will honor any larger times specified by your server. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168276)

value.cfNotes: Setting a TTL of 0 is equivalent to selecting `Respect Existing Headers`

links.title: Change IP Geolocation setting

links.title: Change IPv6 setting
links.description: Enable IPv6 on all subdomains that are Cloudflare enabled.  (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168586)

links.title: Change Minify setting
links.description: Automatically minify certain assets for your website. Refer to [Using Cloudflare Auto Minify](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168196) for more information.

css.description: Automatically minify all CSS files for your website.

html.description: Automatically minify all HTML files for your website.

js.description: Automatically minify all JavaScript files for your website.

links.title: Change Mobile Redirect setting
links.description: Automatically redirect visitors on mobile devices to a mobile-optimized subdomain. Refer to [Understanding Cloudflare Mobile Redirect](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200168336) for more information.

status.description: Whether or not mobile redirect is enabled.

mobile_subdomain.description: Which subdomain prefix you wish to redirect visitors on mobile devices to (subdomain must already exist).

strip_uri.description: Whether to drop the current page path and redirect to the mobile subdomain URL root, or keep the path and redirect to the same page on the mobile subdomain.

links.title: Change Mirage setting
links.description: Automatically optimize image loading for website visitors on mobile devices. Refer to [our blog post](http://blog.cloudflare.com/mirage2-solving-mobile-speed) for more information.

links.title: Change Opportunistic Encryption setting
links.description: Changes Opportunistic Encryption setting.

value.cfNotes: Default value depends on the zone's plan level.

links.title: Change Security Header (HSTS) setting
links.description: Cloudflare security header for a zone.

enabled.description: Whether or not strict transport security is enabled

max_age.description: Max age in seconds of the strict transport security

include_subdomains.description: Include all subdomains for strict transport security

nosniff.description: Whether or not to include 'X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff' header

links.title: Change Security Level setting
links.description: Choose the appropriate security profile for your website, which will automatically adjust each of the security settings. If you choose to customize an individual security setting, the profile will become Custom. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170056)

links.title: Change HTTP2 setting
links.description: Value of the HTTP2 setting.

links.title: Change HTTP3 setting
links.description: Value of the HTTP3 setting.

links.title: Change Origin Max HTTP Version setting
links.description: The highest HTTP version Cloudflare will attempt to use with your origin. This setting allows Cloudflare to make HTTP/2 requests to your origin. (See https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/how-to/enable-http2-to-origin/ for more information.)

value.description: Value of the Origin Max HTTP Version setting (Note: default for Enterprise only is "1")

links.title: Change 0-RTT session resumption setting
links.description: Changes the 0-RTT session resumption setting.

links.title: Change Pseudo IPv4 setting
links.description: Value of the Pseudo IPv4 setting

value.description: Value of the Pseudo IPv4 setting

links.title: Change WebSockets setting
links.description: Changes Websockets setting. For more information about Websockets, please refer to [Using Cloudflare with WebSockets](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200169466-Using-Cloudflare-with-WebSockets).

links.title: Change Image Resizing setting
links.description: Image Resizing provides on-demand resizing, conversion and optimisation for images served through Cloudflare's network. (https://developers.cloudflare.com/images/)

value.description: Whether the feature is enabled, disabled, or enabled in 'open proxy' mode

links.title: Change HTTP/2 Edge Prioritization setting
links.description: Changes HTTP/2 Edge Prioritization setting.

links.title: Change Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress settings
links.description: [Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress](https://developers.cloudflare.com/automatic-platform-optimization/) serves your WordPress site from Cloudflare's edge network and caches third-party fonts.

enabled.description: Indicates whether or not Automatic Platform Optimization is enabled.

cf.description: Indicates whether or not Cloudflare proxy is enabled.

wordpress.description: Indicates whether or not site is powered by WordPress.

wp_plugin.description: Indicates whether or not [Cloudflare for WordPress plugin](https://wordpress.org/plugins/cloudflare/) is installed.

hostnames.description: An array of hostnames where Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress is activated.

cache_by_device_type.description: Indicates whether or not [cache by device type](https://developers.cloudflare.com/automatic-platform-optimization/reference/cache-device-type/) is enabled.

value.title: Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress
value.description: [Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress](https://developers.cloudflare.com/automatic-platform-optimization/) serves your WordPress site from Cloudflare's edge network and caches third-party fonts.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Always Online Mode
objects.description: When enabled, Cloudflare serves limited copies of web pages available from the [Internet Archive's Wayback Machine](https://archive.org/web/) if your server is offline. Refer to [Always Online](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/about/always-online) for more information.

value.cfNotes: Defaults to on for Business+ plans

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Advanced DDoS Protection
objects.description: Advanced protection from Distributed Denial of Service (DDoS) attacks on your website. This is an uneditable value that is 'on' in the case of Business and Enterprise zones

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Brotli Compression
objects.description: When the client requesting an asset supports the brotli compression algorithm, Cloudflare will serve a brotli compressed version of the asset.

value.cfNotes: Setting a TTL of 0 is equivalent to selecting `Respect Existing Headers`

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Browser Cache TTL
objects.description: Browser Cache TTL (in seconds) specifies how long Cloudflare-cached resources will remain on your visitors' computers. Cloudflare will honor any larger times specified by your server. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168276)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Browser Check
objects.description: Browser Integrity Check is similar to Bad Behavior and looks for common HTTP headers abused most commonly by spammers and denies access to your page.  It will also challenge visitors that do not have a user agent or a non standard user agent (also commonly used by abuse bots, crawlers or visitors). (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170086)

id.description: How to flatten the cname destination

value.description: Value of the cname flattening setting

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Cloudflare CNAME Flattening
objects.description: Whether or not cname flattening is on

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Cloudflare Cache Level
objects.description: Cache Level functions based off the setting level. The basic setting will cache most static resources (i.e., css, images, and JavaScript). The simplified setting will ignore the query string when delivering a cached resource. The aggressive setting will cache all static resources, including ones with a query string. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168256)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Challenge Page TTL
objects.description: Specify how long a visitor is allowed access to your site after successfully completing a challenge (such as a CAPTCHA). After the TTL has expired the visitor will have to complete a new challenge. We recommend a 15 - 45 minute setting and will attempt to honor any setting above 45 minutes. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170136)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

time_remaining.cfNotes: The interval (in seconds) from when development mode expires (positive integer) or last expired (negative integer) for the domain. If development mode has never been enabled, this value is false.

objects.title: Development Mode
objects.description: Development Mode temporarily allows you to enter development mode for your websites if you need to make changes to your site. This will bypass Cloudflare's accelerated cache and slow down your site, but is useful if you are making changes to cacheable content (like images, css, or JavaScript) and would like to see those changes right away. Once entered, development mode will last for 3 hours and then automatically toggle off.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Early Hints
objects.description: When enabled, Cloudflare will attempt to speed up overall page loads by serving `103` responses with `Link` headers from the final response. Refer to [Early Hints](https://developers.cloudflare.com/cache/about/early-hints) for more information.

value.cfNotes: The minimum TTL available depends on the plan level of the zone. (Enterprise = 30, Business = 1800, Pro = 3600, Free = 7200)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Edge Cache TTL
objects.description: Time (in seconds) that a resource will be ensured to remain on Cloudflare's cache servers.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Error Pages On
objects.description: Cloudflare will proxy customer error pages on any 502,504 errors on origin server instead of showing a default Cloudflare error page. This does not apply to 522 errors and is limited to Enterprise Zones.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Get String Sort
objects.description: Cloudflare will treat files with the same query strings as the same file in cache, regardless of the order of the query strings. This is limited to Enterprise Zones.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Email Obfuscation
objects.description: Encrypt email adresses on your web page from bots, while keeping them visible to humans. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170016)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Hotlink Protection
objects.description: When enabled, the Hotlink Protection option ensures that other sites cannot suck up your bandwidth by building pages that use images hosted on your site. Anytime a request for an image on your site hits Cloudflare, we check to ensure that it's not another site requesting them. People will still be able to download and view images from your page, but other sites won't be able to steal them for use on their own pages. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170026)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: IP Geolocation
objects.description: Enable IP Geolocation to have Cloudflare geolocate visitors to your website and pass the country code to you. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168236)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: IPv6
objects.description: Enable IPv6 on all subdomains that are Cloudflare enabled.  (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168586)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: WebSockets
objects.description: WebSockets are open connections sustained between the client and the origin server. Inside a WebSockets connection, the client and the origin can pass data back and forth without having to reestablish sessions. This makes exchanging data within a WebSockets connection fast. WebSockets are often used for real-time applications such as live chat and gaming. For more information refer to [Can I use Cloudflare with Websockets](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200169466-Can-I-use-Cloudflare-with-WebSockets-)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Toggle SHA1 support
objects.description: Allow SHA1 support

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: TLS1.2 only
objects.description: Only allows TLS1.2.

css.description: Automatically minify all CSS files for your website.

html.description: Automatically minify all HTML files for your website.

js.description: Automatically minify all JavaScript files for your website.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Auto-Minify Assets
objects.description: Automatically minify certain assets for your website. Refer to [Using Cloudflare Auto Minify](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200168196) for more information.

value.cfNotes: The size depends on the plan level of the zone. (Enterprise = 500, Business = 200, Pro = 100, Free = 100)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Max Upload
objects.description: Maximum size of an allowable upload

status.description: Whether or not mobile redirect is enabled.

mobile_subdomain.description: Which subdomain prefix you wish to redirect visitors on mobile devices to (subdomain must already exist).

strip_uri.description: Whether to drop the current page path and redirect to the mobile subdomain URL root, or keep the path and redirect to the same page on the mobile subdomain.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Mobile Redirect
objects.description: Automatically redirect visitors on mobile devices to a mobile-optimized subdomain. Refer to [Understanding Cloudflare Mobile Redirect](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200168336) for more information.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Mirage Image Optimization
objects.description: Automatically optimize image loading for website visitors on mobile devices. Refer to [our blog post](http://blog.cloudflare.com/mirage2-solving-mobile-speed) for more information.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Polish Image Optimization
objects.description: Removes metadata and compresses your images for faster page load times. Basic (Lossless): Reduce the size of PNG, JPEG, and GIF files - no impact on visual quality. Basic + JPEG (Lossy): Further reduce the size of JPEG files for faster image loading. Larger JPEGs are converted to progressive images, loading a lower-resolution image first and ending in a higher-resolution version. Not recommended for hi-res photography sites.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Polish WebP Conversion
objects.description: When the client requesting the image supports the WebP image codec, and WebP offers a performance advantage over the original image format, Cloudflare will serve a WebP version of the original image.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Prefetch preload
objects.description: Cloudflare will prefetch any URLs that are included in the response headers. This is limited to Enterprise Zones.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Privacy Pass
objects.description: Privacy Pass is a browser extension developed by the Privacy Pass Team to improve the browsing experience for your visitors. Enabling Privacy Pass will reduce the number of CAPTCHAs shown to your visitors. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/115001992652-Privacy-Pass)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Response Buffering
objects.description: Enables or disables buffering of responses from the proxied server. Cloudflare may buffer the whole payload to deliver it at once to the client versus allowing it to be delivered in chunks. By default, the proxied server streams directly and is not buffered by Cloudflare. This is limited to Enterprise Zones.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Rocket Loader
objects.description: Rocket Loader is a general-purpose asynchronous JavaScript optimisation that prioritises rendering your content while loading your site's Javascript asynchronously. Turning on Rocket Loader will immediately improve a web page's rendering time sometimes measured as Time to First Paint (TTFP), and also the `window.onload` time (assuming there is JavaScript on the page). This can have a positive impact on your Google search ranking. When turned on, Rocket Loader will automatically defer the loading of all Javascript referenced in your HTML, with no configuration required. Refer to [Understanding Rocket Loader](https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/articles/200168056) for more information.

id.description: ID of the zone's security header

value.description: Current value of the zone setting

enabled.description: Whether or not strict transport security is enabled

max_age.description: Max age in seconds of the strict transport security

include_subdomains.description: Include all subdomains for strict transport security

nosniff.description: Whether or not to include 'X-Content-Type-Options: nosniff' header

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Security Header
objects.description: Cloudflare security header for a zone.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Security Level
objects.description: Choose the appropriate security profile for your website, which will automatically adjust each of the security settings. If you choose to customize an individual security setting, the profile will become Custom. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170056)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Server Side Exclude
objects.description: If there is sensitive content on your website that you want visible to real visitors, but that you want to hide from suspicious visitors, all you have to do is wrap the content with Cloudflare SSE tags. Wrap any content that you want to be excluded from suspicious visitors in the following SSE tags: <!--sse--><!--/sse-->. For example: <!--sse-->  Bad visitors won't see my phone number, 555-555-5555 <!--/sse-->. Note: SSE only will work with HTML. If you have HTML minification enabled, you won't see the SSE tags in your HTML source when it's served through Cloudflare. SSE will still function in this case, as Cloudflare's HTML minification and SSE functionality occur on-the-fly as the resource moves through our network to the visitor's computer. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170036)

value.cfNotes: Depends on the zone's plan level

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: SSL
objects.description: SSL encrypts your visitor's connection and safeguards credit card numbers and other personal data to and from your website. SSL can take up to 5 minutes to fully activate. Requires Cloudflare active on your root domain or www domain. Off: no SSL between the visitor and Cloudflare, and no SSL between Cloudflare and your web server  (all HTTP traffic). Flexible: SSL between the visitor and Cloudflare -- visitor sees HTTPS on your site, but no SSL between Cloudflare and your web server. You don't need to have an SSL cert on your web server, but your vistors will still see the site as being HTTPS enabled. Full:  SSL between the visitor and Cloudflare -- visitor sees HTTPS on your site, and SSL between Cloudflare and your web server. You'll need to have your own SSL cert or self-signed cert at the very least. Full (Strict): SSL between the visitor and Cloudflare -- visitor sees HTTPS on your site, and SSL between Cloudflare and your web server. You'll need to have a valid SSL certificate installed on your web server. This certificate must be signed by a certificate authority, have an expiration date in the future, and respond for the request domain name (hostname). (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200170416)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: SSL/TLS Recommender
objects.description: Enrollment in the SSL/TLS Recommender service which tries to detect and recommend (by sending periodic emails) the most secure SSL/TLS setting your origin servers support.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: TLS Client Authentication
objects.description: TLS Client Auth requires Cloudflare to connect to your origin server using a client certificate (Enterprise Only)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: True Client IP Header
objects.description: Allows customer to continue to use True Client IP (Akamai feature) in the headers we send to the origin. This is limited to Enterprise Zones.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Proxy Read Timeout
objects.description: Maximum time between two read operations from origin

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Web Application Firewall
objects.description: The WAF examines HTTP requests to your website.  It inspects both GET and POST requests and applies rules to help filter out illegitimate traffic from legitimate website visitors. The Cloudflare WAF inspects website addresses or URLs to detect anything out of the ordinary. If the Cloudflare WAF determines suspicious user behavior, then the WAF will 'challenge' the web visitor with a page that asks them to submit a CAPTCHA successfully  to continue their action. If the challenge is failed, the action will be stopped. What this means is that Cloudflare's WAF will block any traffic identified as illegitimate before it reaches your origin web server. (https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/200172016)

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Zone Minimum TLS Version value
objects.description: Only accepts HTTPS requests that use at least the TLS protocol version specified. For example, if TLS 1.1 is selected, TLS 1.0 connections will be rejected, while 1.1, 1.2, and 1.3 (if enabled) will be permitted.

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.title: Zone ciphers allowed for TLS termination
objects.description: An allowlist of ciphers for TLS termination. These ciphers must be in the BoringSSL format.

value.cfNotes: Default value depends on the zone's plan level.

objects.title: Zone Enable Always Use HTTPS
objects.description: Reply to all requests for URLs that use "http" with a 301 redirect to the equivalent "https" URL. If you only want to redirect for a subset of requests, consider creating an "Always use HTTPS" page rule.

objects.title: Zone Enable Onion Routing

objects.description: Image Resizing provides on-demand resizing, conversion and optimisation for images served through Cloudflare's network. (https://developers.cloudflare.com/images/)

objects.title: HTTP/2 Edge Prioritization
objects.description: HTTP/2 Edge Prioritization optimises the delivery of resources served through HTTP/2 to improve page load performance. It also supports fine control of content delivery when used in conjunction with Workers.

value.description: [Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress](https://developers.cloudflare.com/automatic-platform-optimization/) serves your WordPress site from Cloudflare's edge network and caches third-party fonts.

enabled.description: Indicates whether or not Automatic Platform Optimization is enabled.

cf.description: Indicates whether or not Cloudflare proxy is enabled.

wordpress.description: Indicates whether or not site is powered by WordPress.

wp_plugin.description: Indicates whether or not [Cloudflare for WordPress plugin](https://wordpress.org/plugins/cloudflare/) is installed.

hostnames.description: An array of hostnames where Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress is activated.

cache_by_device_type.description: Indicates whether or not [cache by device type](https://developers.cloudflare.com/automatic-platform-optimization/reference/cache-device-type/) is enabled.

value.title: Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress

editable.description: Whether or not this setting can be modified for this zone (based on your Cloudflare plan level)

modified_on.description: last time this setting was modified

objects.example:
{
  "id": "automatic_platform_optimization",
  "value": {
    "enabled": true,
    "cf": true,
    "wordpress": true,
    "wp_plugin": true,
    "hostnames": [
      "www.example.com",
      "example.com",
      "shop.example.com"
    ],
    "cache_by_device_type": false
  },
  "editable": true,
  "modified_on": "2014-01-01T05:20:00.12345Z"
}
objects.title: Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress
objects.description: [Automatic Platform Optimization for WordPress](https://developers.cloudflare.com/automatic-platform-optimization/) serves your WordPress site from Cloudflare's edge network and caches third-party fonts.

object_definition.title: Zone Settings
object_definition.description: A Zone setting changes how the Zone works in relation to caching, security, or other features of Cloudflare
